DataElement.preferredName: Procedures Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Transplant Conditioning Total-Body Irradiation Intent Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A Yes/No indicator if total-body irradiation intended to be part of conditioning regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedures Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Transplant Conditioning Total-Body Irradiation Intent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the procedures domain.:Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)._A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the procedures domain.

Concepts.definition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the procedures domain.

Property.preferredDefinition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)._A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

Concepts.definition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).
A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
